boardgame.name: Risiko Evolution
Risk Legacy
Risk Revolution
boardgame.description: This description is spoiler free, containing nothing outside the initial rulebook for the game. Details on why this is important in the description._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Risk Legacy represents what is if not a new, at least a rare concept to boardgaming: campaigning. At its core, the game, particularly at first, plays much like regular Risk with a few changes. Players control countries or regions on a map of the world, and through simple combat (with players rolling dice to determine who loses units in each battle) they try to eliminate all opponents from the game board or control a certain number of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;red stars_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, otherwise known as victory points (VPs)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;What's different is that Risk Legacy' changes over time based on the outcome of each game and the various choices made by players. In each game, players choose one of five factions; each faction has uniquely shaped pieces, and more importantly, different rules. At the start of the first game, each of these factions gains the ability to break one minor rule, such as the ability to move troops at any time during your turn, as opposed to only at the end._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;What makes this game unique is that when powers are chosen, players must choose one of their faction's two powers, affix that power's sticker to their faction card, then destroy the card that has the other rule on it _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; and by destroy, the rules mean what they say: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;If a card is DESTROYED, it is removed from the game permanently. Rip it up. Throw it in the trash._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; This key concept permeates through the game. Some things you do in a game will affect it temporarily, while others will affect it permanently. These changes may include boosting the resources of a country (for recruiting troops in lieu of the older _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;match three symbols_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; style of recruiting), adding bonuses or penalties to defending die rolls to countries, or adding permanent continent troop bonuses that may affect all players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The rule book itself is also designed to change as the game continues, with blocks of blank space on the pages to allow for rules additions or changes. Entire sections of rules will not take effect until later in the game. The game box contains different sealed packages and compartments, each with a written condition for opening. The rule book indicates that these contain the rule additions, additional faction powers, and other things that should not be discussed here for spoiler protection._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The winner of each of the first 15 games receives a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;major bonus,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; such as founding a major city (which only he will be allowed to start on in future games), deleting a permanent modifier from the board, destroying a country card (preventing it from providing any resources towards purchasing troops in future games), changing a continent troop bonus, or naming a continent, which gives that player a troop bonus in future games. Players who did not win but were not eliminated are allowed to make minor changes to the world, such as founding a minor city or adding resources to a country._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;It should be noted that although cards are ripped up over the course of the game, there are so many cards added via the sealed packages, that the game does not suffer. Nor is this a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;disposable_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; game, merely a customized one. The game can continue to change beyond the 15 game campaign, and even when it finally does stop changing, you still have a copy of Risk that is completely unique, and plays better than any other version of Risk._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Initial games take approximately 30-90 minutes to play, which includes a brief rules explanation and setup._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

This is a complete copy of Risk Legacy and is from my personal collection--I bought it damaged/new but never got a chance to play it, so the components on the inside are completely unpunched, brand new, sealed and still in the original cling wrap (as applicable). That being said, it was beat up when I bought it, so the outside of the box has some tape, scratches and the like on it... perfect on the inside, rough on the outside? :) Unfortunately my living/storage situation is about to change and so I just don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t have room for it anymore... my loss is definitely your gain in this instance! For peace of mind, the game comes from a non-smoking, no pet home. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m asking $33 for it and I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll take care of the shipping (via USPS parcel post) anywhere within the continental U.S. Not only will you be getting a great deal on a great game, but you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll be supporting a fellow BGG member in the process (and even making my wife happy that I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m thinning the herd!). Thanks so much for your interest and best wishes for the holidays! EDIT: Added some pics as I realized my description may make the exterior sound worse than it actually is :) Again, the insides are essentially brand new, just the outside that has a few dings + stickers.

Never played, but has been taken out of shrink wrap My husband was an avid gamer and collected board games. His profile is on BBG, under Kimbo. He took excellent care of all his games and they are all in great condition. He passed away in 2012, and the time has come for me to start selling games. Please keep in mind that not all games on his list are for sale, but feel free to ask me about any of them. Thank you Buyer pays shipping/handling

THIS IS NOT FOR THE GAME! I got an extra set of envelopes in my game and while they have been opened to check the contents, nothing has been removed. *****SOME SMALL SPOILERS****These contain extra Scar Cards (Mercenary and BioHazard), draft cards, Private Missions, Regular Missions, BLUE faction powers, a World Capitol, and 2 extra Sea Lines stickers. The envelopes are Open When: All 9 Minor Cities have been founded World Capitol is about to go on the board One person signs the board a second time A faction is eliminated from the game Need any other info, please ask. Ships fast from Michigan with the cheapest shipping possible. Pictures available upon request.

WIZARDS OF THE COAST (WOCA53010000) Risk Legacy is different than any other board game, choices players make during game play are permanent and affect every future game. The board is written on, stickers are attached to the rule book, secret envelopes are opened. Game pieces will be destroyed. Ripped up. Gone forever...
